column4: hi, i am having problems installing beryl...it always says no such file or directory when i try to install
is anyone availble to help me?
hi, i am having problems installing beryl...it always says no such file or directory when i try to install
are you just trying to enable desktop effects?  in gutsy you should use compiz, which is installed by default.  Or are you looking to use beryl instead for some reason
simply go to System>Preferences>Appearence>Visual Effects Tab
I believe you will need to use custom settings to enable the cube, there are several different programs that can configure compiz settings in the repo
you will likely have to install it, but after installed you will not have to use sudo
the drivers for USB are part of the kernel, what problem with them are you experiencing?
well that problem is most likely not a problem with USB drivers, but rather ALSA, which handles sound cards
does it play the sound after you login?
what is the output for dpkg -s esound
no that checks to see if the package esound is installed
this might be the problem, but I am not sure, you can install esound with sudo apt-get install esound
you should trying playing sound in something, make sure that AIM still works, see if anything else works, but it might require a restart
